summary: The Gulf of Eilat also called: Gulf of Aqaba  is a wide gulf between the Sinai Peninsula in Egypt and west of the Arabian Peninsula in Saudi Arabia.
full_text: The Gulf of Aqaba or Gulf of Eilat  is a large gulf at the northern tip of the Red Sea, east of the Sinai Peninsula and west of the Arabian mainland. Its coastline is divided between four countries: Egypt, Israel, Jordan, and Saudi Arabia.
title: Gulf of Aqaba
